It still reflects poorly on this if no one can interface with it effectively.

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: I greatly like the interface and the animations, my complaint is in regards to functionality between a chromecast device and its operating system and this software. We use these devices for traveling presentations and many times we have a Hotspot, but there is no cellular service. We greatly need the ability to cast local media without being connected to the Internet. It should be possible to at least cast the device display regardless of if any other features are available. This problem also occurs when the Internet at our apartment goes down, we are still connected to the LAN and I feel that it should be possible to implement an "offline cast" feature for screen mirroring of locally stored content.

Author: BJHutton
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: ChromeUltra, I connect to NBN via Archer D9 modem. Router login and password max 15 characters. Add all device Mac addresses to modem Access control and or Mac filter whitelist. Once connected you can turn off location (drop-outs reactivate). Awesome. Dropouts: 1. Turn off/on modem. 2. Goto modem whitelist, and press save again. 3. Open home app / Settings menu / Account peferences / Clear location / Clear wi-fi / Clear history / re-run Setup. 4. Delete app cache and data / re-run setup. If none of these choices work, give up. Stryker's Lounge | +BJHutton

Text: I was thrilled to see the availability of the new multiple voices and picked one to differentiate "my" assistant's responses from those of my spouse's assistant. I've rebooted, deleted cache, deleted data, rebooted into Safe Mode -- none of those bring show me the 8 voices I saw mere days ago. (I can switch to the "old" male voice via "OK, Google -- change voice", but that doesn't let me select any of the six other new ones.) I finally found a current post on Reddit where several people mentioned the same (disappearing voices) issue, so it appears that the app (or something on the back-end) has introduced a bug. Here's hoping that it gets corrected soon. (And that we get even more voice options in the near future!)

Author: Mitchell Kinger
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: The app has been great and so has the Google products. They're easy to work and support via phone is quick and helpful. Those of you complaining of the Bluetooth speaker hookup, try doing Google search. I did, and found a solution within minutes. In Google Home app, go to devices by clicking top corner icon. Find the device (Google Home) and click the 3 dots. Choose settings. Scroll down until you see "Preview Programme". Turn it on and restart your Google Home. Worked for me first try.

You should make sure the app name in the app drawer is labeled correctly as "Google Home" not just "home" and make sure the app icon remains normal and does not get assigned a different icon via the system or other programs that change icons unless manually done. Great app but for some reason it is not creating the app icon in my app list, and no not hidden, the app is there and I can launch it from Google Play Store and it runs fine but I don't have an app icon to put on my desktop, tried uninstalling re-installing but that didn't fix the problem. I have the note 8 so I have the side menu bar and I can add it there but that's it.

I also tried to restrict Google's access to all my private information by going to activity controls and turning off location tracking history, app use tracking history, etc. Well, guess what? big brother Google does not like that, so they will render your smart speaker useless. Once you turn off access to all of your private information, the Google smart speaker will respond to your commands by saying "actually there are some settings that need to be changed before I can help you". It will not answer any more questions and refuse to function unless you give it access to all your personal information.

Author: Emma T
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I used to love the Google Home controls when I first bought my Google Home Mini. Every since a recent update, I can no longer control the volume with the volume buttons on my device. I can only do it by voice, or by opening the Home app and doing multiple taps to get to the volume control. I love the voice commands when it makes sense to use them, but for the casting volume, I should still have the option to control it with my phone's volume buttons! It's much faster and not awkward like it is to have to keep saying "okay Google" over and over again while the music is playing and guessing the percentage of volume to change it until I get the desired volume. This is so annoying to the point where I stopped using my mini speaker and switched to a Bluetooth speaker. Also, the option to cast is hit or miss. I've had to restart the device and sometimes just talk to it to "wake it up" in order for it to show up as an available device to cast to. And if I say "Okay Google," the phone and the Mini both respond, but they are not synced. My phone will start a call, and the mini will do another call at the same time, but they're two different calls. I'll just use my BT speaker until this gets fixed.

Author: Shawn Malackanich
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: I have 3 google home mini's. All have been working great for months, commands worked flawlessly with no issues. We have several devices hooked up. (Honeywell Thermostat, several plugs from Leviton, and all light switches are Lutron Caseta Smart Lighting).  As of a week ago, I'm having issues.  1. Honeywell Thermostat:      I say, "Set thermostat to 73", and I get a response of, "I'm sorry, there was an error and I'm unable to control your home device".  But, it still changes the settings and does what I ask of it. All other commands work and get I correct responses, "What temp is? Turn on, Turn Off, etc............I've unlinked accounts, relinked, factor reset on google home and thermostat, if it could be reset, I've done it and still get same results.  2. Leviton Plug: I have a fire place that has been hooked up for 3 months and for 3 months we say, "Hey google, turn on / off the fire place", and for 3 months it has worked. As of 2 days ago, googles response, "Sorry, I don't understand" So again, I reset, unlinked, etc....and it still doesn't work. So I experimented and changed the nickname to that plug to several different names, (tree, window, desk) and it works, but when i change it back to THE FIRE PLACE, it doesn't understand. I even changed it to "the fire play" and it worked. Currently its name is, THE FIRE, and it works fine. For some reason google doesn't recognize the word "place" anymore. I also retrained my voice, but this is an issue with all the accounts that are linked with our google homes, so it's just not my voice. Any help from google or anyone would be greatly appreciated. Spent money on these things and for them to not work for simple things is kind of annoying. Really thinking of switching them all out with Alexa. Thanks

Author: Ethan Miguel Serkey
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: When I add a Wi-Fi network with a hidden SSID that's not yet saved on my device( phone or tablet) through the Google Home app at the same time as adding it to a Chromecast or Google Home speaker, the network DOES show up in my device's list of saved networks, and it DOES show that it was Saved by Home, but then it DOESN'T show up in the list of Available Networks( except when connected to it, obviously; but as soon as I disconnect it's gone again), meaning that in order to connect I have to re-add it manually(, including static DNS info because of my router's network security setting) EVERY TIME, which kind of defeats the purpose of saving it to the device's list of networks in the first place; AND, because the network in question is the one to which I just connected the Chromecast or Google Home, that means that I have to manually enter the same network details( DNS and all) on my phone or tablet under Settings > Wi-Fi EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. if I decide I want to cast anything to the TV or sound system from my device when I'm not already connected to Wi-Fi. Please, PLEASE fix this so that saved networks with hidden SSIDs show up when the user views the Available Networks list in Android WiFi Settings, no matter how they were added to the list! and not with a system update, as your company recently announced that my Pixel C and Nexus 6P won't recieve those any more and there's nothing on the market suitable to replace them with until, well, ever and Pixel 3, respectively. Seriously.

Author: Adam Gregory
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Worked flawlessly first time getting a few devices and rooms setup. As soon as I wanted to add a couple more I am unable to edit anything or find / add new devices. Error connection message is now all I get. The app itself seems great if it worked as advertised! Would happily change to 5 stars if it became reliable.

Author: João Grazina
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: The latest Bluetooth speaker connectivity on the Home line improvement made an already amazing product complete, and compelled me to write this review. I also ditched my TV remote, and just tell the assistant to turn the TV off and on via Chromecast. For me the best VPA assistant out there, and affordable to top it all.

Author: T- Smooth
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Unplugged my free home mini. My mini should be able to answer separately from my phone to commands. It can't read back messages and responds when I'm talking to my phone. I want to turn on bluetooth for my phone but the mini responds and it thinks I want my mini bluetooth on. It can't read back messages or locate movies via the Google Play Movies & TV app. Can't cut off my Sony tv running Android. WTH?

Author: Nicole Angel
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: What is going on Google home? I can't cast from my Android phone anymore since a day or so ago. Did the latest update mess something up? My Chromecast doesn't show up at all now for casting when I try to do it from my phone as usual! Everything was working just fine before! Why can't y'all leave stuff alone!? If it ain't broke then don't fix it! What do I do now? How can I cast stuff to my television? Can I do it from my lap top then? I've tried messing with it, but I can't figure out anything and I'm very frustrated! Had a very important show that I wanted to watch. 😞 Help please!

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Need easier way to delete devices out of rooms. Just delete! It's almost like you're trying to force us to put everything into rooms. That's not how I want to use it. Alexa listened and add this feature, just delete a device. Alexa is much better at this point.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Why the heck do I need to give Google Home "location" permissions in order to "find my Google Chromecast device", and why do I need to sign-in to a Google Account in order to stream from my mobile device to my Chromecast device via a direct connection? Lucky for me, I have a Miracast device that addresses every one of these issues - no requirement for un-necessasary permissions, no requirement to sign-in to a Google account and the setup is virtually instantaneous! If you're heavily invested in the Google eco system and you don't care for privacy, Google Home will be right up your alley... On the other hand, if you want a non-proprietary solution that respects your privacy, consider the alternatives - such as Miracast.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Worked perfectly until the other day when I tried to add some devices. Kept getting a connection error when trying to assign a new device to a room. Reset everything and now I can't connect any devices, which renders the home control feature useless.

Author: Gareth Davies
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Load up Chromecast. "Oh, need to connect it to new WiFi". load up Home App. "Let's Get Started" ok. "Sign in to get [blahblahblah]". attempt to sign in. "This accounts already exists on your device". Well, DURR, you piece of $£%# app. "Find my Account". type in details. NOTHING! ABSOLUTELY SMEGGING NOTHING!

Author: Mark Bond
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Help please. When I am listening to Spotify via Android auto driving home and someone at home asks to play something on Google home in the kitchen at the same time, songs stop playing in my car. Very annoying! What can I do to stop this.

Author: Jay Martin
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Loved the app since my first install. However since I expanded my hone connections nothing has worked properly. I keep getting "check your connection" error messages. I want you go back to loving this app, not wondering if I need to delete it

Author: Chris Holgate
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Connection issue when trying to add other devices (LightwaveRF specifically). Google need to clean house before Amazon and Apple get too far ahead in the home automation business! The app is atrocious to navigate with confusing menus. C'mon Google I got faith in you!

Author: Robert Sparrow
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Would give this app 5 stars but recently purchased a new tablet running android 4.4.2 so that I could cast the screen. Unfortunately I get message to say device is not optimised. Apart from that everything else works just great.

Author: emma wray
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Chromecast worked fine for the first few months but now it cuts out all of the time even when my Wi-Fi is fine and that is even if we can get anything to connect. Even YouTube app has trouble connecting. It's all updated and connected I've done all troubleshooting and still nothing. I thought this was awesome for the price but now not so keen

Author: Sean Wurzburg
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Chromecast Ultra is a waste of money and time. Roku out performs it 10 fold. Plus I get a remote and my phone doesn't drain due Google forgetting to add something so simple. Waste of $70. Hopefully get $40 from some sucker

Author: Andrew J Gower
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: It takes about 300 attempts before I can successfully mirror my phone to my TV. Infuriating. It's a pitiful app compared to Alexa's. Most of the time, actions performed in this app have no effect on the Google Home devices.

Author: Elyse Swoverland
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: It's become unusable with Hue lights. I'm unable to add new lights or relink my account. I cannot modify/delete rooms or change the rooms devices are in as I get a "check your connection" error every time. This has been going on for months with no communication from Google.

Author: Ro Nin
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Seems to only be available of you have an AI speaker attached to your house/WiFi, already. Also only likely to work, if your "smart Tv" is *by default*, enabled to support Google Home (imo, ALL Android Tv's should be). Annoying that they are somehow, not.

Author: Nene Smith
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Since the last update, Chrome extension on laptop can't recognise the casting destination (a few feet away). Have to mirror my ph to tv then disconnect, sometimes a few times, then laptop recognises the casting destination again. Then sometimes i can't stop the cast. It's a pain. Clearing cache made no difference. Worked before, now it's glitchy & unreliable.

Author: Matt Pellerin
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Many people commenting blame the app when it's the cheap hardware or old OS versions that are the problem. This works flawlessly when used as intended for my Android TV, Nexus Player, Google Home, and Google Home mini...along with a bunch of WEMO, Nest, and Ring products.

Author: أبو وسام
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: very bad experiment with this stupid chromecast device.. better to use miracast instead. it is cheaper and easier to use. i've got headache of trying to show my phone on the tv but at last i found no solution for that

Author: Hugh Hasan
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Worked superbly every time at first. It's stopped working now and after a few minutes of casting my screen, it just crashes and the tablet reboots....really!!?? On an Android machine!!?? Isn't this a Google product on a Google OS....maybe it works better on an Apple. Wouldn't be surprised at all. Damn, get your act together Google!!!

Author: Dan Roberts
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Worked great first time, casting to android TV with built in Chromecast, then on second use would not find device. Kept trying but got fed up. Uninstalled.

Author: Christopher Johnson
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Please ADD SLEEP FUNCTION for Chromecast. Annoying that Chromecast is missing basic sleep function. Gets powered down a lot of the time and put in the drawer bc I don't want it on, constantly. Sleep would be a great addition.

Author: Philip Dimmock
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Never have I used a worse app. It doesn't even make sense why a huge company can't even get a simple app to work. For years this app has been unpredictable and faulty and it never gets fixed. I payed good money to be able to use this with chrome cast and it rarely works. Why is it that smaller companies have apps that work well but google can't get their act together. If you want a reliable app stay away from this until someone gets it sorted but don't hold your breath. I've been waiting almost 10 years. KMT

Author: John Womble
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: App works great with all my connected devices. Most the reviews seem to be people that struggle with tech and are using old and unsupported devices. Blame the manufacturer of your crappy tv. Not the app.

Author: Audrey Floyd
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Well there are ups and downs. The down is it keeps poping up on my screen at random times. Also when I talk to it and i'm in the middle of something it pops up. One annoying thing with the device is that it !akes you pay for using Spotify. It's more like when you want a specific song. Please fix this. But the ups are that I can request a certain singer. Another up is that it can reconize what i'm saying even when i'm really sleepy. And thats all. Please add more features.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I've had one for a few days. It can't do much at all. And looks to me that google has dropped It, like so many of their things.

Author: Rishi 102
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Fantastic product and app. The only things that you can do to improve it is sending emails and adding items to shopping list in Google keep. Since having to make calls on the Google home is has been really useful.

Author: nikita crump
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Will not adjust to new address. If I ask my "commute to work" it always tells me commute time from my old address. But if I ask "how's my commute from HOME to work?" It'll tell me from my new, current address. So annoying. I've tried to play with it, reset it, anything to make it register that my address is different in the settings, but it will not adjust. Wth

Author: Keaira Mitchell
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: It has been an absolute nightmare trying to get this Chromecast to work. I bought my mom one years ago when I was a young teen. Was easily able to set everything up. Now this thing only works when it wants. Deleting the app and returning the Chromecast.

Author: Brek Darling
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: What a nightmare. Wishing I hadn't bought into home/Chromecast. The devices take down my internet 3-4 times a week. Evidently a patch went out in January, but this is NOT fixed. Only way to stop them from playing when they disappear is unplugging them. Really disappointed; deserves 0 stars currently. Previous review: Add volume to notification. Add go to streaming Chromecast on notification click

Author: A Spencer
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: This application will only work if I either reboot my phone or reinstall the app each time. You would think that a Google app would work with Chromecast. This app does not work.

Author: Jim Ahrens
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It's recently stopped working with Hue lights and linking the TV and Netflix account together does not work either. Maybe they don't care for the UK or maybe it's another one of Google's good ideas that they got bored of and left to rust. Might work, might not.

Author: Thomas Gallagher
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Poorly designed mess. I'm a die-hard Google fan but stuff like this makes me understand why people choose the Apple ecosystem.

Author: Andrew S
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: The app menu still does not work. The first few selections do nothing (music, shopping, etc.) I asked a question and never got a response. It's a known issue with several solutions but none of them work for me. One day this app might work.

Author: Simon Roberts
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: What the hell has happened..... After latest Home update my google home keeps telling me to log in through the home app. Have reset but no joy. My 4k chromecast, and google home are now useless pieces of expensive plastic !!!!!

Author: Arjan van Noort
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It worked fine with third party app for home control. After adding devices (smart we link app). It did not longer link the app. Tried it on a older phone and still nothing. Seems to be a Assistant issue. Home control is now limited to the native app. Awaiting a solution like update

Author: Sara Eisen
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Very frustrated. Every time I tell the home to play one of my playlists, from Google music, it plays a random playlist. Please fix, I just want to listen to my music.

Author: Tatiana Hatfield
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: As of this year I can't seem to connect to the vast device in my tv. I'm connected to the same Wi-Fi as the device but I can't connect at all!!! And even if I try to reboot it, it still won't work! This problem is really eating me up because I want to use my tv and watch movies and my shows but I can't do that anymore as of this new update. 😡

Author: Will Higgins
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: This app keeps getting worse and worse with every update. Functionality keeps getting removed. Don't buy Google Homes or Chromecast, get the Amazon Echo instead.

Author: Laswhawn Wiley
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I was frustrated with the recent update rendering my hue light controls useless. It kept giving me an error saying web page can't be found when trying to add my hue lights. After speaking with Googlehelp desk we solved the problem. Cleared cashe on google home and Google assistant, then completely logged out of hue account. From that point i was able to log back into hue account and reconnect lights. I'm happy that they now work again.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Useless app. Doesn't work consistently. Cant delete rooms. Doesn't link accounts. Consistently complains about connection when everything else works. Absolute rubbish. Google's support is equally pathetic.

Author: Robert Froud
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: A little temperamental. Especially with third-party apps. If it could diagnose why something isn't working at a given moment that would save time lost to fault finding.

Author: George Slusher
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Everytime I connect, my roommate sees it on his phone. An when he disconnects his. It turns mine off. How does he have access to it when it's connected to my phone?

Author: Rebecca Briggs
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Wish the google homes would work with basic commands without a network available and same goes for google chrome cast! I don't have permanent home WiFi or constant 4G or 3G signal. Would be so much happier if they accounted for people like me! And also fix to be able to set up easily with ones own hot spot

Author: Jordan Busiakiewicz
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It was fine for some time, but now I noticed small problem. There is no chromecast button when I'm watching some videos in chrome on android in desktop view. Anyway the button is visible in mobile version (I mean when I untick desktop view in chrome). Any solution for this? I can of course switching manually to mobile view when want to cast but mobile versions of pages are usually strange and ugly designed.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Pretty poor app. Very difficult to set things up. Will not link to your Google Play music without a premium subscription. Alexa is far better at this point in time.

Author: Sandeep Gupta
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Not able to access home control menu. Have a bunch of added smart devices for home control is not loading since few days. All devices are synced via voice command and were showing until few days back.

Author: Terry Jackson
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Optimised for S7 down but not current S8???? Sharing screen was optimised enough that previous version worked just fine. Why optimise it to remove sharing for S8 that worked? That is not optimising, that is just called stupid.... get a grip Google.

Author: Charles Roberts
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Works like a charm. For everything except for Chromecast. Which, you know, I'm paying a $10 a month subscription for integration with.. Both this and Google home get back their five stars when they work together for a longer duration than one or two songs. Very very well-documented. It is Google Play music that is the problem, because every other app works fine. Peck Amazon music through Chromecast actually works super reliably. I don't know if that's the kind of standard you want to be maintaining. This keeps up, I'm going to drop this subscription I'm paying you ten bucks a month for and give it to Amazon. At least they know how to use your device. Geez, you make both products, could you go across the hall and fix this garbage?

Author: TK Designs
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Don't know what happened. Had some update for the Routines. Tried re labeling some rooms to utilize this and it said to "check connection". So I removed the accounts and tried re linking them. Now I can't re link and now have no control on anything.

Author: Lucas MH
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: There should be more customization with the new "Routine" part. There's only a certain number of routines and they only have a certain number of actions (e.g. Saying "I'm leaving" only gives you 2 actions). When it says "adjust lights" it doesn't allow you to adjust them, only turn them off and on, even though ihave adjustable smart bulbs. Very limited app.

Author: Turina Williams
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: If I'd known in advance how frustrating this gadget is, I would have just bought a tv! I bought this as I am not tech savvy and was told it was easy and painless to use. Ha! What a joke. Everytime I use it, I have to restart my phone. If I put it on pause while I do other things, it disconnects and I have to go through the process all over again. As for screen casting from my phone (I have neither a computer or tablet), there should be a way to "hide SMS while casting". I would not recommend this. Waste of $50 I see from all the other comments, Google hasn't responded. Go figure, typical multi-million dollar company

Author: Amit Gupta
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: This bloody device chromecast is so troublesome that its only 10% of fun and 90% of issue, setup, reboot, fixes and abuse to developers. Not even Google Photos cast properly on it, how can you expect other apps to work well. Only youtube works well if you are lucky enough to resolve all the setup issues. Seems like a big conspiracy to promote Youtube here. Do not buy Chromecast if not already bought. Go for something better.

Author: Mani rajan
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Not able to cast apps instantly. Each and every time I had to clear cache in app and then I have to cast. Cant able to cast Amazon video. Consuming loads of data. Useless kindly try fire stick.

Author: Gothic Emeritus
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Great potential

Author: Rick Buchholz
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Chromecast has worked fine for years. Came home and message on screen says download Google Home app. 3 hours later can't get it to work. Went online and ordered Fire stick. Problem solved.

Author: Graham Stevens
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Where is the bluetooth speaker option? Rebooted, refreshed, read and re-read instructions and still no clue how to add the bluetooth speaker...very confusing. Why can't the apps just be simple and work?

Author: Myah Vassell
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Cast Screen and Audio barley working. Majorly lagging constantly. Closing it completely. Not every worth using it anymore. Fix this!

Author: Steve Shilling
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: This app couldn't get past the find your account screen. Total rubbish. You'd have thought it would be able to find accounts on your phone

Author: Wesley White
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Worked fantastically until the last update unlinked all my devices, but having to relink everyone's devices is a pain. It had a 5 star rating till the last update now I'm giving it a 1 star. Updates shouldn't break current functionality nor should they ever be forced which this one was.

Author: Lilly Kelly
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I am beyond pissed at this app. All I want it for an app to play my god damn playlist. I started Pandora premium, Spotify premium, and YouTube red to try to get a playlist to play. Not one playlist will play from any of my apps. I have when through the set up several times making sure they're all use the same email I restarted everything minimum of 5 times including my phone and the mini it's self. The app gives no instructions for fixing these issues. No ability to show Google that I have many playlist and no way to fix my issues. So I rate this app 1 star because I've spent now 8 hours total trying to get a playlist to play. Please fix my issues before I break my mini or my phone. Sincerely, very busy pissed off college student.

Author: Jacob Shollenberger
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: MAGNIFICENT app gets your passwords and pins on all devices. In doing so it gains full access and and and that's it. Nothing is provided, everything it is described to be is bogus mambo jumbo. It's designed to gather sensitive information in return not provide any features zilch. Bait and switch. Oh one feature a complaint button. THANKS GOOGLE

Author: Akash Shrivastava
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Everything important or useful is stuck at least 3 menus/clicks down. Why is it that the second tab "Discover" is the most useless tab and still given so much real estate. Needs to be redesigned from the ground up

Author: T. D-va
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I am tired of the stupid ads that pop up every 5 mins on my phone! I am gonna resell this trash,( if someone is interested)and will forget about it's existing! Expensive useless toy!

Author: Buzz1014 Aj
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I was able to connect my Google home mini very easy. Only problem I want the Google assistant on my phone which is Android 7.0, but the app is still not available and I want to know why. Thanks for listening.

Author: Mersudin Kovacevic
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: What are you doing Google? Now I can't turn on the lights or anything. I get the message to log in. I'm already logged in.

Author: Sandy Lo
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: App shows 6 devices linked but no device cards! Can't make any changes or updates to each item, or create multiple groups for music. Soooo frustrating! PS. Reset multiple times already, Uninstalled and reinstalled but no luck! WTH! Text: I have two Chromecast Audios which have been working well with my old phone (HTC One M7) which used Android 5. I normally use Spotify for streaming to the Chromecasts (which has worked with no problems on my old HTC One). Now Spotify works fine once I've got the Chromecasts to appear, but when I stop casting the Pixel forgets about the Chromecasts again. I have no problems at all with my Toshiba Chromebook which will always see the Chromecasts and connect to them when using Spotify. I assume this is a Home problem on Pixel 2 or on Android 8, and not a Spotify problem. I can stream from my Pixel phone to a Bluetooth speaker from Spotify with no problem.

Text: I have had chromcast for about 4 years, everything was working fine until a few days ago. Turned on TV to cast a show and chromecast will not connect to my WiFi. Ended up having to factory reset my chromcast and powering down my rooter. After setting up chromcast again (curiously the location had to be on), I could cast again. Next day, turn on my TV and chromcast wasn't connected to WiFi. I had to AGAIN factory reset my chromcast and rooter box. Not going to do this every time I want to watch TV... About to find something else.

Author: Matthew Balestra
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: I STILL don't have the option of adding calendars other than my main Google one... When will this be available??? The app is actually pretty good! I just wanted to comment that the home mini needs to be able to stream music via Bluetooth! Since there's no aux, it's very necessary. I don't want to buy chromecasts for every room or speaker. Please!

Author: Alizbeth Lule
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: This app used to work perfectly on my old phone but since ive switched to the galaxy note 8, this app no longer works. Ive tried several times to connect to my device and it will say "connecting..... ", immediately followed by "casting ended". Ive tried reinstalling. Restarting my phone. Ive even emailed the help service at least 3 or 4 times, and have yet to hear anything. Im uninstalling until this is fixed.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Requires turning on browsing and activity history across all of Google devices and websites to work. Requires constant location tracking on your phone to allow set up of any smart home devices, including a simple lamp switch. Users are not even given a choice on what they want to share to "improve" their experience. It's either everything everywhere, or google home won't work. Thanks google for making my choice so easy. Bye bye google home, hello Alexa!

Author: Mitch Allen
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Every single time it's the same. It works fine then you update the app and it plays up. The latest problems is that every time I want to watch something I have to reboot the Chromecast device, then set it up. It won't connect so I then have to reboot the device again, go through the set up again and it'll connect. Then the next day I want to watch something, and I have to repeat this process. It worked fine until the latest update. Please just leave things alone. If it ain't broke, don't fix it!

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Multi-user not working with Galaxy s8 as it's frozen on "please wait" screen before I even get to say voice commands. IPhones in family had no issue registering their voices. Bixby is turned off, location within US, done factory reset and reboot various times.

Author: David Batta
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Little more than a novelty. As long as you convert to all Google in Gmail it might work okay. But to be useful it needs to connect to other systems such as Office 365. I only keep one calendar and Google is not it. It's a good thing I got my Google Home Free or I'd be sending it back. For something useful argues Alexa which will integrate more with Business Systems.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: I am all Google. I have android phone, tablet, gmail, calendar, docs, etc. I actually got an Alexa first but her knowledge can be spotty. Other than that, love her. I got a Google Home for free and I was so excited. Finally I am able to use Google search engine for info. It won't stay connected to my wifi and all of the instruction s on Google's site does not work in my app. The instructions are for a different version? I have a Galaxy s7. The Home app is up to date yet no instructions for how to fix my wifi issues with the app that I have. Good thing I have Alexa.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I was supposed to get a free $25 Walmart coupon when I purchase it from Walmart. It says on the instructions that they are "easy steps" to follow, but there was no coupon. Also, everytime I try to open the shopping list, music, more settings in the app, it does not open. I like the Google Home Mini device except I wanna the issues addressed above to be fixed

Author: K Laouali
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Useful but I find many things that can't work yet. I'd like to have Google Translate and Google Maps be able to work with the home devices. Another thing I noticed is Google can't properly edit Google Calendar through the home devices. These are all things that are commonly used. I love the help of step by step recipes but even more I love how she sings to the baby when I need her to. Not to mention the great altering of some of the most morbidly traditional nursery songs...good job!

Author: Anthony Monaghan
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I bought a Google home mini for Christmas and it worked fine. Unfortunately, my tp-link light switches and harmony remote kept getting disconnected from my wifi. I unplugged the Google home and this stopped happening. I recommend googling Google home and Wi-Fi to discover more about this issue. A fix is allegedly in the works and was supposed to be released today, but saw nothing as of yet.

Author: Ashly Guillory
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Id like to be able to just give her its own name and just say whatever her name is to start her up. And her veing wireless would be much more convenient for me. It would also be nice if we could plug in headphones. Or link to things like the stereo and or other things with blue tooth capabilities. Also, if shr had a strong of lights we could see at all times to match beats or something like that and she came in other colors too. Maybe put the google colored logo on her instead of the grey.

Author: Justin I'Onn
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: My Chromecast updated its software when I turned-on my bedroom TV earlier today. It now won't show-up as a discoverable device. Yes, I've done a hard reset on the device by pressing the button, and I've also reinstalled this app. Went through the setup fine. Just won't show up one setup completed!

Author: Eric Shaffer
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Why would an app, that you must install to set up Google devices, start out in a place that might not necessarily show you the devices in your home. Users do not expect to be shown promoted content before being able to access and configure their devices so don't do that. Take users right where they expect, device setup and configuration and let the user go deeper to see what cool things they can do with their Google devices.

Author: Arno Boyaciyan
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Used to work fine. It now instantly disconnects when trying to mirror screen. YouTube casting still works fine. I've uninstalled, factory reset, and made sure microphone permissions are granted - all with no success. I guess Google cares more about Pixel phones now and screws everyone else over.

Author: Courtney Roberts
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: I'm glad that there is a way to turn off the notification for when the Chromecast is playing, however there's still no real way to limit who has access to or control over my Chromecast. Again, huge nuisance. It would be nice to be able to enjoy my videos without others hijacking it at any given moment.

Author: Vincent Zerveskes
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: When it works it works good. Seems to not recognize ANY devices from time to time for absolutely no reason. Sometimes resetting EVERYTHING doesn't even help. Happens at least several times per week. If this was a better product it would also work on non-Google devices...

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It seems the functionality on the Canadian version of the app is not the same as the US version. For example we added some Home Mini' s to our network and the voice changed to a male voice. You are supposed to be able to change this in the preferences but the option is not there. The only thing you can do in preferences is change from Celsius to Fahrenheit. That's not the only difference. Don't know why the app can't be the same world wide......

Author: goverat
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Same wifi network, unable to connect multiple devices or link multiple accounts. None on the online tutorials help as things have changed, blue 'links' don't do anything. I'd return the Google home to the store, but it was a free-be with a phone. More useful as a dog toy

Author: Paul Lachowsky
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Love everything about this app, EXCEPT how grocery lists are handled. It used to be that adding items to my list added them to my Google keep grocery list. Perfect for sharing with my wife. The new online function is worthless. It splits lists between me and my wife, so we can't both access lists. Please, please, please go back to using Google keep!

Author: Shannon Squires
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Used to work fine back when it was just chromecast. Now its Google Home it constantly loses connection to every Chromecast in the house,using any type of phone, can't pause or stop casts without reconnecting first. Can't get through any movie or show without problems

Author: Ina Wang
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I love this! My only complaint is that I wish I could set a different prompt for Google Home Mini versus the one on my phone. That ways, my phone can differentiate when I'm using it or not. (Ex: I keep using ok Google to make phone calls. So when I'm at home the mini will automatically dial instead of my cell)

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Google Home mini does less than what a Bluetooth speaker can do. It can't make calls. It refuses to play music without paying a hefty monthly subscription and it gets a lot of questions wrong. It's a totally pointless device. A novelty toy.

Author: Kim Gregory
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Can no longer cast my screen or other apps, doesn't see my chrome cast and says no compatible devices found but can cast YouTube no probs but not any of my other apps. Useless now. Was workng fine until the last update, now it's as useful as a chocolate tea pot! Please revert update to last one until you can figure out an app that actually works. Update. Chrome cast now in the bin, bought a Roku instead, works like a dream

Author: Elijah Duran
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: It's good for what it knows. Sure would like to be able to control my Pentair Pool controls, though. EDIT: Google needs to catch up and play nice. Echo is now nor compatible with services and apps I actually use. You are on notice, Alphabet.

Author: Ian James
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: As a Stand-Alone speaker... Pretty good doesn't work out for Android TV. Contemplating the decision to buy. I've repeatedly given feedback to the Google Home System, but to no avail. Months of updates and Home tells me to use my remote. I'm not going to be happy til it works on all my TV's.

Author: Matthew Levin
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Won't play music from my library, plays awful Google radio stations instead. Will set alarms but then they don't go off. I have 2 Google home speakers and a Chromecast and I find the whole system useless. What a waste.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Can not connect to Google home with my android phone was told at store I could I do not have Wi-Fi service only hot spot and Bluetooth but was told could still connect to Google home with phone. Just wanted to sell me something I guess . No merry christmas

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I wonder now why this don't Google Home don't read my Chromecast if I use it yesterday and today no? If something get me upset is coming from outside to my home and this app and YouTube don't read my chromecast. This is every day struggle with this.

Author: Leon Prawiro
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Out of the box it works for streaming supported apps like photos and YouTube. Casting Desktop screen works fine using laptop, but casting from my Android Device doesn't work. Hopefully this could be resolved as it doesn't deliver full potential now.

Author: Suraj Niroula
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Was working very well but feel like lot of bugs were introduced in the latest release. Device tab doesnt show devices. Keep getting errors that my tp link plugs are not linked even though app shows they are linked. Very frustrating..

Author: Justin Logan
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: You have to have location on to set up a new device which is annoying for someone who keeps GPS off. I wasn't able to put in my work location since my work doesn't really have an address it could find, I feel that part should use a map to find the location instead of a text bar for inputting an address. Would be nice to set up netflix to use different profiles too.

Author: Jon Tarczewski
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Why do I need to use ifttt to get custom commands? This should be built in. Also the home only recognizes my custom command once every 4 tries these days. Very frustrating.

Author: Jeffrey Clement
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Love and hate relationship. I love what it does when connected to Wi-Fi. But it is useless when on its own. You think you'd be able to at least cast your phone or something. And also hate how the wrong temperature shows up. 10 degrees off. And no way to really change it.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: All I want to do is mirror my phone to my tv... Why did Google have to break the standards just to force feed Chromecast. I bought a pixel xl to get away from Samsung bloatware but Google is worse. They make their own standards. Don't try to be Apple I liked android because it wasn't Apple.

Author: Jeffrey Vasey
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I have a multitude of smart home devices and loved Google Home until recently. When I had to modify my home network, I discovered that the home control features simply won't connect/sync...and, for now, can't work. That includes Hue lights, Wemo switches and Honeywell. Very disappointed.

Author: Sandy Lee
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: For crying out loud, I've got 2 screaming kids wanting to watch something via chromecast but your stupid update has rendered my chromecast inoperable. Can't connect to it anymore? Please release update as soon as possible or clearly explain how to fix this via your deep deep omnipresent settings!

Author: Andrew Mitchell
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Only issue is everynow and then it stops recognizing my devices and I have to reboot it and start all over, also the security features don't work on my shared network so the other people on the WiFi see that I'm casting and can pause or stop it... Kinda a giant pain in the ass... But when it works.. It's. Fine

Author: Lucero Ramirez
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Had to do two factory resets today because it wasn't showing up. The first one was a complete failure. Second one, it started working fine until I had to leave to run errands. I come back home to be met with my device not showing up- AGAIN. It ALWAYS disconnects. Anytime I want to use it, my device doesn't appear on my app and I have to do a reset each time. Ive sent feedback over and over and asked to be contacted and still nothing.

Author: Matteo Di Iorio
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Text: I disagree with several choices the Google Home team has made that I feel have made the product worse but it's still a solid, if overly complicated, option for smart home services. The Google Assistant really is unmatched as far as voice assistants go so I'm willing to give back on some other usability for that....FOR NOW.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I am surprised it Wasn't planned or spoke about in design stage? ...music is important and I should be able to link Google to my nice sounding bose system?...cause it sounds like a tin can sound that comes out of it....yuk...too bad it won't play on Bluetooth devices

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Over 35 messages back and forth between google support teir 1 who have have raised it to there teir 2 and 3 support with no outcome. I have no feed back from the upper teirs and no change with my app/account issue. there for the poor rating. the product works well and would like to buy more of them but the app/account issue is stopping me hence the poor rating.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: It is ALWAYS difficult to set the chromecast up. Why is it so complicated. I bought it once and tried to set up with my student accommodation wifi and it didn't work because it needed a private network. Why couldn't they have mentioned that. ? Hence i had to return it. I purchased it the second time when i moved houses and this time the house has a private wifi network and guess what, Google chromecast crapped again during the set up. I didn't even get the taste of it, it shat before even I could get started. So frustrated and disappointed. If this continues Google will definitely face criticism like Apple. Meanwhile Im trying ways to set this good forsaken devise up.

Author: Benjamin Williams
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

Author: Henry Bell
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Voice training was a pain for multi-user. Trained it, then an hour later it said I needed to voice train it again. Latest Home firmware update killed the TV on/off I had with my Chromecast Ultra.

Author: sue newhouse
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: [Chromecast] Does exactly what it says. Easy setup, works on all my devices, no matter type or brand - phones, tablets, pc, TV - all for $35. What's not to love?

Author: Rory Fargo
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Read the feedback report I just submitted. I have have 3 TV's with Chromecast and one with Chromecast Ultra since Google Home I have only been able to get a connection intermittently. Not happy!

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Why is there no way for Android phones to have context-aware volume buttons? I think it's absolutely ridiculous that if I want to change the volume on my Google Home, I have to open the app, find the device, click on it, then change the volume (the circular slider is awful, by the way). I've even experienced the above scenario not working. I controlled the music through Spotify and connected that way. I also controlled it with my laptop at one point. After a while, I was no longer able to control the volume through Spotify or the Home app. This means the only way to change the volume would be to use voice commands or get up and change it manually. I think that volume buttons should be able to control whatever connected device is currently playing media from my phone.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Used to love it until I had to change the Wifi settings. The configuration does not exist in the place it's supposed to and removing the device simply does not work as it continues to show up in several places places inside the app. Reistalling the app does not work, wrong config is kept regardless. Only solution is to do it from another google account and mobile device. First time config is easy, fast and simple, too bad I can never use it from my main account again.

Author: Anshul Jain

This happens a few times a week. Its very annoying. And i have two devices and one was purchased two months ago. Horrible service. It use to work great and now its awful. Shame on you google. Way to ruin a good thing. I wont ever purchase another chromecast.

Rarely works the way it's supposed to, the app is a total mess; too many settings and they're not arranged in a user friendly way. and would it be too much to ask that, for example, when you say "hey google, how do I set up calling?" GOOGLE HOME KNOWS ITS OWN SETUP?? it started reading me results from the web about Alexa. seriously. what a joke.

Author: Candice Howard
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: It is ludicrous that Google Home cannot link with Google Keep for the shopping list function. You know... An app where you can actually sort items, manually reorder items according to your store's layout, delete items. I know those are crazy expectations, but someone (Keep) has figured it out. Instead, the shopping list opens a website (what if I don't have a signal?) where I can do none of those things. I can't even export the list so that it could be imported into Keep. The other functions on home are nice, but this one thing is so VERY BAD it lowers the whole score.

Author: Elizabeth Fusselman
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: This might very more stars if it would play my Playlists on GPM. I don't want to buy a subscription, so the fix everywhere says to create a playlist & add what ever music I want to play into the playlist... Done & it still won't play it. I feel like 1 Google product should easily be able to talk to another Google product. As of right now, this is just a waste of time and money. :(

Author: Michael Stein
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: The last update or two has really ruined the Chromecast experience. You can start a casted show only to have the the device you are casting to show up in the "Linked Devices" section and you are unable to do anything. Then you must start up the laborious troubleshooting process of cycling WiFi on your phone, cycling phone, cycling the Chromecast, cycling router... There was a time when I would recommend Chromecast to nearly everyone as fantastic product at an insanely low price. Now I am not sure if I would recommend this experience if the device itself was free.

I was so excited to compare google home and alexa, but the primary use case for me is home entertainment control and in that, google home is woefully inept.

Author: Malachi Bazar
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: The app serves it's purpose and it does it well. The only problems I've noticed are 1. There are no ways to determine which Google user has "admin" rights to the devices. Because of this, any person on your WiFi with a Google account can have full control of your devices. 2. There needs to be a way to skip, like, and dislike songs from the app, because if the music is being casted from your computer, there is almost no control for the phone and Visa versa. 3. I have the Essential phone, and this is the only app that messes up the top of the screen. Overall the app is good and does what it needs to.

Ive tried to contact a Help Service about this and there has been no response for several weeks. If I had been asked to review the app a year ago it would have been 4 stars; now, I can only say 1.

Author: Stewart Midwinter
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: When the app was called Google Cast, I used to be able to talk my microphone and ask what's on my Chromecast, and get information on the image currently displayed. Now that it's called Google home, asking this question does nothing. I can no longer tell watch in the images I am viewing. Pisses me off! It used to be possible to find out what backdrop image was displaying after three or four clicks. But with the latest version of Google home the only thing you can do with your list of devices is unlink them. It is now impossible to find the source of the image or, what interests me most, the location of it. This is going in the wrong direction!

Author: Michael Hamlin
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Every time I ask my Google Home device to remind me or ask what is on my calendar, it cannot recognize my voice. So, I try to retrain it in the app ( why should I need to do this every day?), I can't. The app cannot open my microphone on my Google Pixel XL phone. I have tried turning off all other apps that have permission to my microphone, but that has not solved the issue. About the only thing this is good for is asking the weather or playing music. You can't reliably use it for functions that are specific to your profile or voice.

Author: Ethan Wilson
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: The app is just quite poor in general. For the Google home, it's hard to find the settings you want sometimes. Also, updating settings such as the name and room of a Google home or smart device takes a very long time and normally displays "cannot update that setting, check your connection" when I'm clearly connected. Sometimes this does actually change the setting anyway, sometimes not. Also, trying to add a Philips Hue account to the app was a nightmare, with the big I talked about above happening, and also Google Assistant saying the light says on when it didn't turn on. Considering this app is designed for exactly the purposes I described, and that it's made by Google, this is shocking.

Author: Justin Wake
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: -Setup can be confusing. You'd think the devices screen would show all devices, not just Google devices. -I'd like the ability to link devices to a specific speaker. For instance, linking my living room lights and my living room Google Home so I can say "turn on the lights" and have just the living room lights turn on rather than the entire house. -Phones/tablets should be included in devices to allow customization, playback, and the ability to use an old device like it's a Google Home speaker. -The speaker has a habit of activating without anything remotely resembling "okay/hey Google" being audible in the house. It can get really annoying when watching a movie/show due to the volume drop on the TV when this occurs.

Author: Chris Papalazarou
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I switched to Google Home from Amazon Echo, and I have to say it's been a lackluster experience from the device itself to the app that is supposed to integrate everything. Whenever I update my Philips Hue setup, I need to unlink my account and start from scratch. Adjusting volume within my Spotify app on my phone only sometimes affects the volume on the Google Home speaker. It seems to want to push more music apps on you than is necessary, though I wonder if those apps have better integration. Overall it feels like a dumbed down version of what Amazon is offering with their Alexa app, with manual integration of all your devices. It works well enough for music, but it's smart home functions leave a lot to be desired.

Author: Ryan Fricke

Author: Steve Davis
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Google Home is smart home. No application is perfect, but the Google Home actually does more than I expected. It can play music or comfortable sounds to help me get to sleep. Setting an alarm for weekdays at 6am is as easy as saying set my alarm for 6am on weekdays. No more forgetting to add something to a shopping list. Google assistant will do that too. Hey Google I want to add something to my shopping list. I did run into what I thought was a problem when setting calendar reminders etc. I felt rushed to have a good title in my mind while waiting for Google Assistant to acknowledge me. However I discovered that I simply ask for a calendar reminder and it will ask for the title and then set it. I was also using calendar reminders as a notepad which is better left for a list. So Google Home actually helped organize my communication skills as well. My only criticism is that it is missing the feedback for manners unless explicitly asked. I want my children (and myself included) to remember to say please and thank you, and not to talk to others like slaves.

Im currently trying to reinstall my WiFi connection after a factory reset. In general, the installation process seems too point-and-click, making it difficult to troubleshoot WiFi connection problems. The only options are to click on the network or manually enter the WiFi network details, add an additional connector, reboot the device or factory reset. The options mentioned on the Chromecast website for rebooting/resetting within Google Home do not seem to be available in this version of the app. Basically, every option I've tried hasn't fixed it. Please update the app.

Text: Great app, very quick and easy to set Google home products up. Helpful tips to help you get the most out of them too. I have most products Google has to offer and I love the way it all links together. My family also love putting it to the test. Would recommend to anyone. It's the future people 😁

Author: Nathaniel Terry
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Every time I attempt to get my chromecast enabled TV to link up it says I need to update the app. The app is fully updated though.

Author: Noah Kromer
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Of course I have to like the app at least a little bit, because it's the only way I can set up and run Google home speakers. And there isn't anything bad to say per se except that there's a lot of things to do within this application and it needs very clear and concise navigation. There is always going to be a learning curve in this type of application. But the problem is they keep changing things within the app and then cannot keep up with the changes on their online help pages. Sometimes it is faster to get information about a function that has changed name or location within the app, from the public on a message board or other means. So I guess my complaints can be summed up as they keep changing the names of functions. They keep splitting functions into two different new names. They are unable to keep up with the many changes they make with their own help pages. Because Google does not put out a concise how to use this app, such an obvious and clear bullet point in development of keeping the navigation consistent, should be a given.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: The best app for people who love to reboot their devices 👍 It's the only way to get it to detect devices, it's awesome. And when you forget to disconnect before leaving your home, you'll have to reboot again! Perfect 👌 And if you forget that you're casting audio when you leave your phone behind, silent, when you return, your battery is dead. How awesome is that? 😉 Oh, and the best part:Google made it, so every update makes it buggier! Woo-hoo 😃Best. Money. Spent. Ever. I'm definitely buying Google again next time 💕

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: This app perfectly complements the simplicity of what voice control was initially ment to embrace. It deserves every bit of the 5 stars. After running it through a super-sensitive improvement scan this is the only suggestion: If there were widgets - really only one would do. This would be absolutely marvelous. A simple pause/play button with a volume bar, and maybe a button you can hold to prompt Google Home to listen (like you do when you long-press the top of the Home). Easily accessible from your home-screen. Convient - simple - marvelous - yes, yes indeed.

Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: It's nice to be able to connect all your smart devices to Google. But this app is missing a key feature, and that's the ability to control the devices through the app. I wish this app was more like homekit and allowed me to have widgets on my screen that allowed me to control my different product not just the Chromecast
